dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: Fire-retardant plywood; Moisture-resistant plywood; Wire mesh plywood; Sign-grade plywood; Pressure-treated plywood; Baltic Birch plywood; Hardwood plywood; Softwood plywood,胶合板、纤维板、刨花板、其他人造板（非木质人造板、细工木板、胶合木、重组装饰材、饰面人造板等）
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Plywoods include fire-retardant, moisture-resistant, wire mesh, sign-grade, and pressure-treated types. They may be treated with various chemicals for fireproofing. Baltic Birch plywood is a product of an area around the Baltic Sea. These sheets are strong but heavy, used for applications like subflooring, cabinetmaking, and furniture. Plywood is a structural material consisting of sheets of wood glued or cemented together with the grains of adjacent layers arranged at right angles or at a wide angle. It is known as manufactured or engineered wood, made by combing many hundreds of thin strips or veneers of wood, which can come from a variety of trees and tree types, various hardwood and softwood variants.
